title: Area Volume with pond part - d

content.description: Let R be the region bounded by the graphs of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>sin</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>π</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41EB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F99@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, as shown in the figure above.
content.question: The region R models the surface of a small pond. At all points in R at a distance x from the y-axis, the depth of the water is given by h(x) = 3 -x. Find the volume of water in the pond.

frqParts.text: The region R models the surface of a small pond. At all points in R at a distance x from the y-axis, the depth of the water is given by h(x) = 3 -x. Find the volume of water in the pond.

topic.text: 8.7: Volumes with Cross Sections - Squares and Rectangles

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
